alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 8:36AM PDT until May 09 at 2:51PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding on the north and west forks of Salmon Creek is occurring. This has been compounded by releases on from the Conconully Reservoir into the Salmon Creek. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Okanogan. * WHEN...Until 845 AM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 831 AM PDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Okanogan and Conconully. - Areas downstream on the Muckamuck burn scar will also be affected. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Significant flooding of creeks and roads is likely.
